definitions.definition: the act or process of putting people or things into a group or class (= of classifying them)

examples.text: a style of music that defies classification *(= is like no other)*
a style of dancing that defies classification
the broad classification of music into classical and pop

definitions.definition: a group, class, division, etc. into which somebody or something is put

examples.text: a document with the security classification ‘confidential’
The material was put into the highest security classification.
These messages could be said to fall under the classification of ‘abuse’.
Electric bikes are in the same classification as mopeds.
The classification ‘science’ covers a great many different subjects.

definitions.definition: the act of putting animals, plants, etc. into groups, classes or divisions according to their characteristics

examples.text: The classification of bony fish is extremely complicated.

definitions.definition: a system of arranging books, tapes, magazines, etc. in a library into groups according to their subject
